oai_dc:dc.dc:title: NCDP-plated CdSe film PEC cell studies
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: KUMAR, M
SHARAN, MK
SHARON, M
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: ncdp
electroless
cdse
thin film
photoelectrochemical
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Thin films of CdSe grown by non-catalytic displacement plating (NCDP) are characterised electrochemically and photoelectrochemically in polysulphide electrolyte; using Cyclic Voltammetry in dark and under intermittent illumination, band edges of NCDP-plated CdSe are located. A depletion width of 2 mu m is calculated across the CdSe/S2-/S-2(2-) interface. Charge-transfer mechanism across this junction is dicussed. Electrochemical and photoelectrochemical stabilities of NCDP-plated CdSe electrode are studied. Efficiency and fill facto; of as-fabricated photoelectrochemical (PEG) cell are found to be 1.02% and 0.34, respectively.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: SOLAR ENERGY MATERIALS AND SOLAR CELLS, 51(1), 35-45
